intro: Petrophile globifera, commonly known as the globeflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its distinctive globular flower heads, which are composed of numerous small, pinkish to white flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Petrophile globifera is adapted to arid conditions and is an important component of native vegetation in its habitat.
